Sentencas: In order to validate the reaction mechanism of porous LSCF oxygen electrodes, a set of experiments has been conducted on two types of symmetrical cells exhibiting different microstructures.
Titulo: Experimental validation of a La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ electrode model operated in electrolysis mode: Understanding the reaction pathway under anodic polarization

Sentencas: In both cases, the polarization curves exhibit a dissymmetry with a transition at low anodic overpotential associated to a modification in the shape of the electrochemical impedance spectra.
Titulo: Experimental validation of a La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ electrode model operated in electrolysis mode: Understanding the reaction pathway under anodic polarization

Sentencas: To interpret the experimental results, a micro-scale electrode model including two reaction pathways has been used.
Titulo: Experimental validation of a La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ electrode model operated in electrolysis mode: Understanding the reaction pathway under anodic polarization

Sentencas: The model considers an oxidation/reduction at TPBs (surface path) in parallel to an oxygen transfer at the gas/LSCF interface (bulk path).
Titulo: Experimental validation of a La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ electrode model operated in electrolysis mode: Understanding the reaction pathway under anodic polarization

Sentencas: Thanks to a 3D electrode reconstruction, the simulations have been performed with a reduced number of unknown parameters.
Titulo: Experimental validation of a La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ electrode model operated in electrolysis mode: Understanding the reaction pathway under anodic polarization

Sentencas: It has been found that the simulated data are in good agreement with the experimental polarization curves and impedance spectra at OCP as well as under anodic polarization.
Titulo: Experimental validation of a La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ electrode model operated in electrolysis mode: Understanding the reaction pathway under anodic polarization

Sentencas: Once validated, the model has been used to unravel the complex electrode operating mechanisms in electrolysis mode.
Titulo: Experimental validation of a La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ electrode model operated in electrolysis mode: Understanding the reaction pathway under anodic polarization

Sentencas: The simulations have shown that the transition detected at low anodic polarization is due to a change in the dominant reaction mechanism passing from the bulk to the surface path.
Titulo: Experimental validation of a La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ electrode model operated in electrolysis mode: Understanding the reaction pathway under anodic polarization

Sentencas: Moreover, the relative contribution of the two pathways has been investigated as a function of temperature.
Titulo: Experimental validation of a La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ electrode model operated in electrolysis mode: Understanding the reaction pathway under anodic polarization
